parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
The Sabbath, a week.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
Late, evening. From opse; late; feminine afternoon or nightfall.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a door, (b) met: an opportunity. Apparently a primary word; a portal or entrance.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Feminine Plural
str2: To shut, shut up. A primary verb; to close.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
